Constructor Detail

OverlayJPanel

public OverlayJPanel()
Constructor - sets the opaqueness of the JPanel to false.

Method Detail

help

public static void help()
This method will be used to display help information about this overlay. It should open it's own JFrame with information about the overlay.

getFocus

public void getFocus()
This method requests window focus for the overlay. If focus is wanted by a private data member of an overlay, this method should be overloaded to have the data member itself call requestFocus().

Specified by:
getFocus in interface IOverlay

setObjectState

public abstract void setObjectState(ObjectState new_state)
This method will set the current state variables of the object to state variables wrapped in the ObjectState passed in.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
new_state -

getObjectState

public abstract ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

kill

public abstract void kill()
This method is called by to inform the overlay that it is no longer needed. In turn, the overlay closes all windows created by it before closing.
